I purchased a domain through this company because they seemed to offer a good deal. However, upon getting access to my domain I realized I have very limited access to the DNS. The website builder is a joke and does little to offer any sort of actual customization. I was forced to purchase another domain in order to conduct my business and use the Webador domain as a redirect. Because their DNS is laughable and restrictive, I had to find alternate routes in order to do a basic redirect. For this reason, I anticipated when the time my domain became available for transfer (60 days after registration) and I was aware they had a 30-day cancellation period. After submitting my cancellation request, someone from their company comes back via email (yes, only way to contact them), and tells me that I must wait 90 days to transfer my domain, and that it has been sent to some other host and is no longer in their possession. I also received an automated email confirming that apparently, despite the domain being registered to me and inaccessible to me, it is fully accessible to anyone else who would like to obtain it. Then, a completely different representative from the company sends me a follow-up email and explains that her colleague was incorrect about some of the things conveyed, and correct about others. What initially was supposed to be a simple purchase has now turned into a 3-month headache that has the potential to cause damages to me and my business as stated by them my property has the potential to become possessed by a 3rd party entity.Now, if any of this has you confused, you're not alone. Clearly the business called Webador has no idea what they're doing either. They conduct business in a manner that is incongruent with their competitors, provide services that are laughable at best, and then force inconsistent and inexcusable policies on their customers.In short, I highly recommend you conduct business elsewhere, with a reputable and trustworthy company as this one in particular will bring nothing but headaches and difficulties.

After four months they informed me that I could in fact duplicate pages from my second website (I had already built it and didn’t want to have to dismantle my first website and rebuild it), and paste the duplications onto my first website. They then told me that they would do it for me with my consent, I consented, they confirmed they had done it and nothing. They did nothing. LMAO at this point what was I expecting. I asked to be compensated by extending my subscription for four months and they were rude, lied to my face saying they had resolved my issue when I resolved it myself and told me they would no longer respond to my emails. Honestly, the amount of time I’ve wasted, frustration I’ve incurred and the impact on my business… this whole experience has been awful and would have been avoided with knowledgable and helpful support rather than incompetent robots. Please do not place any order with them unless you are 100% sure that you understand as to what is good or bad for you with this service. Although they advertise that there is a 30 day money back guarantee but that is not the case. This as you will see is clearly put on Trustpilot quoting by them that they offer 3 months full refund guarantee. Well having purchased their hosting service and having had a look in 2 days I requested refund which they have refused giving all sorts of feeble excuses. Now I have lost full 1 year subscription which they have pocketed under false mis-description.  Furthermore their service/website is difficult to operate if you are not very technical minded. There is no telephone support - each time you need help you have to log a ticket/send a message and wait for them to come back. I have copy documents proving my case and in spite of me showing reasonableness and communicating with them in the nicest possible way the refund is refused. SO PLEASE BE CAREFUL AND IF YOU WISH TO DO BUSINESS WITH THEM THEN TAKE EVERYTHING IN WRITING.I WISH I HAD FOLLOWED MY OWN ADVICE.

Review.Titre: Worst website provider I’ve seen in a long time
Review.Contenu: Hello, So I used their service for 3 months and the subscription was only 1£ for the first 3 months, but then they started to charge me the full price, once I got the invoice I immediately cancelled the subscription hoping to get back the money, but they answered that the cancellation was done to late, so okey I didn’t get my money back, next month they charged me AGAIN the full price, now I was really upset so I once again contacted them, and this time they responded by saying that I cancelled my subscription ONE DAY to late, literally I cancelled it right after they charged me the full price first time (ONE MONTH BEFOREHAND). Now I’ve deleted my account and they just charged me this next month for nothing, haven’t been using any of their services for past 2 months. So I just recommend not using their services, the first 3 month discount is pretty much a trap, so people would get charged the next 2 months for just not being able to cancel subscription. For example you forgot about your subscription, and they charged you the full price, and now that you know you forgot to cancel it, when you cancel you still need to pay for the next month. AMAZING!Imagine you have a bad memory or God forbid alzheimers ,they would just invoice you anyways, because you agreed to terms and conditions.

This was one of the easiest sites I have ever put together. I have worked with computers since the early 90s and I found the editor and the offerings top-notch. I created a beautiful and useful site in about a half a day. Everything is streamlined, available and insightfully placed for ease of access. My site looks wonderful and modern. I highly recommend that people give this a try whether you are a highly technical user or a  non-technical user. You will be surprised and pleased. I have had to downsize this for the following reason. The biggest downside of this site is that you will still not be found unless you use a paid version, even if you set your setting correctly on the seo portion, I tried searching for my page and was not able to find it  the only way I could get to it was using the direct address. That makes it fairly pointless to create a website that can't be found. I will upgrade this if this changes in the future. UPDATE 5/20/22 Received an emai, which was nice it was written to me and I appreciate that they took the time to do this, like I said was nice, they explained that it is out of their hands and some stuff that google does not like sites with advertising and so on. The entire internet is one big advertising platform and almost every site I visit I am barraged with advertising so I know that can't be true, however I do know that they have the free sites locked down - meaning they are not submitted and may have a robot file directing google and other search engines away from them. Like I said I have been on the internet since the early 90's and I have kept up with some things. I also know that it can take time for Google to find a site so I will wait a few more weeks then look for another platform. this is pretty much usless to me if I cannot be found by a search engine without putting out a bucket of money. My site is for a public purpose to assist with voting and I will not reap any benefits from it monetarily. It deos however benefit me when I am researching candidates.

Review.Titre: Good company as long as you don't try to leave
Review.Contenu: Webador was a good company.  Service had always been very good.  That was until I tried to leave.  I requested that they release my domain name so that I could use it with a different provider.  I sent them the initial email on 3rd September 2020.  On 4th September 2020, I had to email them again to request that they cancel my subscription.  I received an email back saying that my Pro plan was cancelled and would expire on 27th October 2020.  I was a little bit unsure as to why so I went back to re-read the terms and conditions.  I found that they required a one-month cancellation notice but my payment was due to in the middle of that month.  So I emailed them again and offered to pay the next payment and requested that I had my domain released.  I said I didn't mind paying on 28th September 2020 even though I wasn't planning to use the site as it was me that wanted to end the contract and I didn't want to wait until the expiry date.  I had no issue paying the September payment.  All I wanted was my domain name released. The company I want to switch to suggested that I request that Webador "pointed" my domain to their servers and gave me the information which I passed on to Webador but they still won't do that. I was considering leaving them a good review in my blog when my new website was uploaded, until I had this problem.Update: Webador have now dropped my domain name today (27th September 2020) even though they specifically told me they couldn't until 27th October 2020.  I now cannot access my emails, even though I was expecting some to come in.  I can't connect my domain name to my new website provider still as it's still showing as unavailable.  Yes I wanted them to drop my domain name but I was willing to wait until 27th October since they said it couldn't be dropped earlier.  I didn't want it dropped unexpectedly like that.  I wouldn't have sent out those emails yesterday if I'd have known they were just gonna drop my domain just like that, with no warning!

Review.Titre: This website has a bad payment system
If I could score a 0 I would.
Review.Contenu: If I could score a 0 I would.I am a regular 5 star person and it takes a lot for me to write a bad review but this took the cake. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!I really really wish I checked out the one star reviews before I signed up for my issue is identical to theirs. In June I attempted to cancel my domain, I followed their help section and clicked cancel and the page took me back to the home page - NO ERROR MESSAGE, NO PLEASE CONTACT CUSTOMER SERVICE so I believed all was well. Then I was billed in July. I thought okay my fault, maybe I didn't click all the buttons I was supposed to or missed a step. Let me try again, so in July I cancelled again. Followed every step they said, even though it took me round the bend a few times, I clicked cancel and i thought it was done with. Now they are trying to bill me again for August and WORSE they now say i owe them for September as well???? In all the years I dealt with Wix in America I never had this kind of scam like customer service! I then emailed to ask for the Aug invoice to be cancelled explaining the whole situation and low and behold I got a series of extremely rude and discourteous emails from one person, who I'm starting to think is the only person who works there suspiciously and so i responded aggravated in kind.   I then asked for this to be escalated to a manager of which i was told they would just say the same as her. I then asked for a phone call to calmly discuss the matter, suddenly they dont have one phone for such occasions? Her snobby email kept advising on policy... newsflash... you have nothing in your policy when it comes to clients who try to cancel who get no error message indicating their cancellation didnt work! There wasnt even a pop up to say please contact customer service but i was supposed to be psychic and just know the cancellation didnt go through and contact them. This has been the worst experience ever and I took time out of work to deal with it. I will be going to social media and trading standards about this as they are trying still to take money out of my account and its now classified as stealing. AGAIN BEWARE! DONT USE UNLESS YOUR PLANNING TO STAY WITH THEM FOR LIFE as you will never stop paying them.    BTW, They only have 500 followers on Insta and they don't answer any of their twitter comments and im fairly sure the 5 star reviews on this platform are not 100% genuine or are people who haven't tried to leave them yet. This isnt defamation its the truth and a real life story.****In reply to the review reply -1. No one threatened anyone2. I did not opt out to try and cancel my subscription that’s absurd3. As explained, trust pilot reviewed my review and posted it saying it was fine so another lie exposed4. Your still charging me for august so why are you saying you have cancelled all the charges, another lie.Everything I have said in my review is fact and if in doubt check out the other 1 star reviews. You can’t call us all liars.Seriously all, do not use this company!

Review.Titre: Simple builder, but there are other options
Review.Contenu: It is an easy and very basic website creator that lacks a lot of options. There is a paywall that clears up some of them, but there should be basic QoL items considering there are ads on your page when you want to see it. HTML editing should be one of them, as the framework for pages is there, but minor changes that require any sort of option added is locked behind said paywall. It also does not allow for indexing on their ad-induced free section, so honestly... do not bother unless you are going to subscribe to their services. There are other options out there that can do what this does and allow for HTML and Google indexing, or you will never be found on the web unless you give your URL to anyone specifically.

Review.Titre: Site is wonky between switching languages
Review.Contenu: I apologize I can only rate 3 stars from my experience despite being pretty sure there are numerous other good features I've yet to discover, but I faced so many difficulties while attempting to build my website here. Perhaps it's just my own personal opinion that is unique, similar to someone who finds iPhone interface not very user-friendly compared to Android even though the whole world prefer Apple products. Reading the reviews here, I can't deny that a part of me wished to still be using Webador for my site, but being in Italy perhaps, the site gets a little wonky here and there, making it uncomfortable for me to keep switching the site back to English. It's almost as if the English site is separated from the Italian site and they don't sync with whatever edits I made. It was a frustrating experience with so much refreshing and redoing.Again, maybe it was just that one day when I was working on it. But I stopped instantly after that and decided to stop using it altogether after discovering another platform. Therefore, I can't tell whether Webador is actually a good choice overall.Nevertheless, thank you for the opportunity and I'll definitely try again in the future in case there's some new improvements.

Review.Titre: Very primitive and unwilling to improve
Review.Contenu: I have two websites with Webador, so I think I am by now an experienced client. I also have several websites with Weebly, so I can compare both effectively.On the plus side, easy to use and the blog page is great. I also like the fact that you can copy some elements from one page to another (e.g., the contact me and Calendly buttons) and that buttons can be colored and have icons.On the negative side✅ Highly ineffective assistance -- they are always nice in responding, but never seem to resolve anything. It's like little platitudes all the time, but serious, super ineffective✅ Very very limited font sizing -- Weebly has more, and Weebly is not THAT great.✅ No way of having a picture be the actual background of a page, which you'd think they would have resolved by now✅ Webador is a single page, they don't have "sections" like Weebly and they have not figured out how to integrate pictures in text✅ They have not been able to figure out how to drop a picture inside a text box✅ There are many other tools that other services have (e.g., making pictures automatically round, or having line dividers between columns) which are sorely missing here.💡 So, here's an idea, Mssrs Webadors... why don't you get a paid subscription to Weebly, Wix, Carrd and a few other services and just steal the best ideas?🌩️ And a big brainstorm... how about actually speaking to your customers and just creating an open-ended survey: which other services do you use and what ideas do you think we should rip off?

Review.Titre: A system within a system to improve the system.  First design the system so it meets it's purpose in the most efficient way to the general public
Review.Contenu: It seemed nice an easy to get to the stage of creating the website and the templates were easy to setup and they were indeed free.  I'm a technical person though with experience so I think could have been better in terms of talking to the average user!  These people really don't know how to do much on a computer and they are just hoping it's going to be click this button, choose this style and get this website.  Which in some ways when you think about it, it should be like that, but it isn't, why not?  It's actually designing a signup process to give the user exactly what you say he gets in the free package and use as little steps as possible for him to get there.  It should be the easiest thing in the world to come up with so why isn't it?  You need to make money from it and you're under the illusion that if you hide marketing and signups within the process and make it more complicated for the user then you will get more signups.  What if you got more signups because the process was the best signup process in itself!  Basically you complicated a "sign up process" by doing something within to get more sign ups and ruining the sign up process.  Not necessarily in my opinion because I used to run my own IT business so I know how things are done and how to get around them but the average user wanting a new website which could potentially be a guy accessing a computer for the first time isn't going to get to the stage I did very quickly at all.

Review.Titre: Nice Website Builder with Limited Url linking
Review.Contenu: Update: I was the very 1st reviewer on Trustpilot.I was asked to make a review in exchange for a free ad site, which has not been applied yet, even though I contacted them.In reply to Webador's answer on my review, I don't think they grasp what I was teaching them in terms of good marketing to gain more users. I did not say I wanted to upload my own videos. I only want to insert video links from another video host platform other than youtube. I can't use their product if I can't even see if a simple html video link would work. Because of this Webador restriction, I found I can create and publish a static html website and link non-youtube videos for free on other platforms.While Webador got a respectful, and balanced review and free marketing advice from me.Original Review:I like the website builder. Its very user friendly and not complicated.I have a small website that is just for a few viewers so I find the free plan is all I would need, but I found out stumbling block after much time as I made a few pages.I have my videos stored on a video streaming host that is not youtube or vimeo. The price to level up in order to place a url of a video not on youtube or vimeo is too high. FYI: Paying is also required to use Embed html vids.If they changed the Free plan to ALLOW videos hosted on other platforms -  then I'd say this is a great place. They can do this by allowing special categories in the free plan to have this feature. For example: For very small websites like a memorial site or Special categories/something like that - which could be a good marketing tool and bring more popularity to this site.(Which would help them as usually cdn hosted video and images are a lot faster, smaller and secure that would help their server end, especially since they wouldn't be uploaded) So to offer this in the Free category woud help them/not hurt them, as to pay only to use non-youtube or non-vimeo links can be a deal breaker and stop growth in future customer base/relationship.If you only have images or just words then this would be a good way to go. You will have their subdomain website name.I hope they will allow video urls from other hosts cdn's or embed vid players in the free plan feature, Soon. Then people can see if its worth it to pay in the future if their website grows.

Review.Titre: I loved using Webador to build my…
Review.Contenu: I loved using Webador to build my online shop. Hence the four stars. It would have been 5 stars but I have deducted a star for the amount of time it takes to get a response to a request for help.Webador is my 2nd attempt at building an online shop. The 1st was one of the biggest providers in the UK and was way more complicated than Webador. I'm so glad I made the swap. I'm a complete novice and technophobe but Webador made it easy.The only thing that changed my experience from 5 stars to 4 stars is the manner in which you have to request help. I knew at the outset that there would be no telephone support. That wasn't an issue. I had assumed, wrongly it seems, that there would be a webchat facility. But in fact, the support is essentially by email. This is very frustrating when you have what should essentially be a short question to answer, but you have to send an email andcwait for a response. You can wait anywhere up to 24 hours to hear back from them. During that time my webshop is probably loosing money because customer have no idea how the cursor functions and there's not an obvious setting to change it from hover to click. The help guides can be difficult to use as well.I wouldn't want to go to another company. But I would rather be placed in a queue on a live chat than be frustrated waiting for an email that may take 24 hours be sent.

Review.Titre: Good Website Builder With A Few Flaws.
Review.Contenu: I was browsing around for a website builder, and I have tried a couple such as Weebly and Wix.Then I stumbled across Webador as I was searching around, and I noticed that the features may seem too good to be true at first, and it is somewhat.A gripe that I have with Webador is that it doesn't really tell you what features are exclusively for Pro or Business when you edit your website until you try to use them.  Yes, I am aware that they provide a list of what tiers have, but I think it would be beneficial if it some of the features, such as the photo album, would have like a label that only Pro/Business account can have.  Lite allows you to have a custom domain, but that's it.It would be nice if said features would allow you to toy them, but it wouldn't be able to publish the site until it was deleted, but Webador auto-saves your work, which is really nice!  This would really benefit people to give these premium features a try before buying, even if Webador gives a generous discount in the first year of subscription.It's pretty straightforward and doesn't involve coding (unless you want to try your hand with custom HTML feature, which also requires pro/business account).Webador doesn't allow too much customization for different pages for free, in which their selling point is getting to the point and ease of use for other people, which it clearly shows!That being said, the Free plan offers quite a bit for those what want to give Webador a try.Other than that, Webador does have potential and their support has been fantastic!  They were able to answer my questions that I had for them!  However, support isn't immediate (seems like a 24 hour turn around) so I would keep that in mind.  Webador is also one of the more affordable website builders you can get.  I'm looking forward to see how Webador grows in a span of years.

Webador Website Builder FeedbackJithu MarkoseShare a First of all, I must say that Webador is a great website builder platform with a lot of potential. The platform offers a variety of features and tools to create a website that suits one's needs. The templates are visually appealing, and the drag-and-drop interface is user-friendly, making it easy for anyone to use.However, there are a few areas where I believe Webador can improve to enhance its service and make it even more user-friendly. Here are some suggestions:Improve the speed and performance of the platform: While the platform is easy to use, it can be slow at times, which can be frustrating for users. Improving the speed and performance of the platform would greatly enhance the user experience.Offer more customization options: While the templates are visually appealing, they can feel somewhat limiting when it comes to customization. Offering more options for users to customize their websites would allow them to create a more unique and personalized site.Provide more detailed tutorials and support: While the platform is relatively user-friendly, it can be difficult for beginners to get started. Providing more detailed tutorials and support would help users get up and running more quickly.Overall, I believe that Webador is a great website builder platform, and with a few improvements, it has the potential to be even better. By improving the speed and performance of the platform, offering more customization options, and providing more detailed tutorials and support, Webador can enhance its service and become even more user-friendly.
